results.title: Pictures and words
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television training film”.
Deals with the art and techniques of writing film commentaries. Illustrates the best way of making shot lists, timing the words with the pictures, and letting the pictures speak for themselves. Shows the pitfalls of various techniques, how the same pictures can tell a different story with a different commentary and what a skilful writer can do. Ends in the dubbing theatre with commentary, music and effects being recorded to the pictures.

results.title: Planes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Shows a typical carpenter’s bench and describes correct layout of bench stops when planing wood. Different types of planes and their uses.

results.title: Veneering by the hammer method
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”
Introduction to veneers, topside and underside, Keying the ground on a radio cabinet, applying the glue and using the hammer, gouging out the corners and inlaying.

results.title: Veneering by the caul method
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”
Four-piece veneer decoration of a panel. The film demonstrates: drawing the design on paper in actual size, making a template and cutting the veneers, laying it down on paper, use of the veneer hammer, transferring to the panel, cramping, removing the paper base and cleaning-up

results.title: Crossbanding and jointing veneers
results.creator_credit: Topical Film Company and K. Baron Hartley
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Both sides of the wood are veneered to prevent warping. The method of making this is demonstrated through an example of a door made of laminated wood. It is explained how to veneer the face of the door to match the edges and when a piece of veneer is not wide enough to cover a surface, how a joint must be made.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Topical Film Company and K. Baron Hartley

results.title: The Sentence of the court
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Scene”.
This docudrama looks at what the subsequent history might have been of the boys in the gang that attacked the conductor in the film the “Last Bus” (Title code 006006). Examines the factors which might have caused the boys behaviour, their likely punishment and its effect on them. Companion film to “Last Bus”.
